steps.title: Use about half a pound (250 grams) oyster mushrooms.
steps.content: Use about half a pound (250 grams) oyster mushrooms.

steps.title: Separate each mushroom from the bunch and shred any larger mushrooms into smaller pieces with your hands.
steps.content: Separate each mushroom from the bunch and shred any larger mushrooms into smaller pieces with your hands.

steps.title: Place mushrooms in a plastic/zip log bag and add 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon thyme, half a teaspoon fine salt and 2 tablespoons flour (use corn flour for gluten-free option).
steps.content: Place mushrooms in a plastic/zip log bag and add 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon thyme, half a teaspoon fine salt and 2 tablespoons flour (use corn flour for gluten-free option). Close the bag and shake well to coat.

steps.title: Transfer mushrooms in a single layer to a baking pan lined with baking paper.
steps.content: Transfer mushrooms in a single layer to a baking pan lined with baking paper.

steps.title: Bake in a preheated oven at 350 ℉ (175 ℃) for about an hour or until very crispy.
steps.content: Bake in a preheated oven at 350 ℉ (175 ℃) for about an hour or until very crispy.

steps.title: Eat immediately or cool completely on a rack and store in an airtight container for up to 2-3 days.
steps.content: Eat immediately or cool completely on a rack and store in an airtight container for up to 2-3 days.
